seo.title: Sunrise Hike from Hostel Brikette (Positano)
seo.description: A short pre-dawn hike from Hostel Brikette to a quiet viewpoint above Positano, with navigation photos in the correct order.

linkLabel: Sunrise Hike: Watch Dawn Break Over Positano
intro: If you want the simplest sunrise, you can watch dawn from the hostel’s common terrace as the sun rises to the left (when you’re looking out to sea).
If you want a wider panorama and a quieter moment above town, follow this short hike up into the hills for a clifftop viewpoint over Positano.

sections.title: What is the Sunrise Hike?
body: This is a short, pre‑dawn out‑and‑back walk from Hostel Brikette to a small viewpoint above Positano.

If you want a longer mountain option, %LINK:santaMariaDelCastelloHike|Santa Maria del Castello% is a great alternative, but the route below is the quickest way to get a dramatic sunrise view without committing to a full-day hike.

sections.title: Before you go (it will be dark)
body: Bring a phone light or headlamp, and keep your hands free (especially on the stairs).
Wear shoes with grip — the first part is paved, but the woodland trail can be loose or damp.
Start early enough that you arrive 10–15 minutes before sunrise so you can settle in, find your spot, and enjoy the first light.

sections.title: Step 1: Walk from the hostel to the staircase (≈350 m)
body: Exit the hostel through the main door and walk down to the road.
Turn toward Sorrento and walk about **350 metres** along the main road until you reach a staircase climbing up from the road.

sections.title: Step 2: Climb to the house, then turn left
body: Take the staircase all the way up until you reach the old white house pictured below.
At the house, **turn left** to join the woodland trail.

images.alt: Old white house beside the staircase on the sunrise hike route above Positano
images.caption: This building marks the end of the staircase climb; turn left here to enter the woodland trail.

sections.title: Step 3: Follow the woodland trail to the viewpoint
body: Follow the woodland trail as it climbs gently away from the house.
When the trail branches, take the **right** branch.
You’ll eventually reach a point where the trees open and you can see the sea straight ahead. From there, head around to your **left**.
That leftward path brings you to the viewpoint. You can scramble carefully up the rocks for a higher perch, or stay at the main spot for a stable view.

images.alt: Overhead map view showing the final turns on the sunrise hike route to the viewpoint above Positano
images.caption: Use this overhead view to confirm the final left turn toward the viewpoint after the trail opens to the sea.

sections.title: Share this guide (QR)
body: If you’re heading out with friends, you can use this QR code to quickly share the guide on another phone.

images.alt: QR code linking to the Hostel Brikette sunrise hike guide

essentials: Headlamp or phone light (plus a charged battery).
Shoes with grip and a light layer — it can feel cool and breezy before dawn.
Water and a small snack if you plan to sit and watch the sunrise.
tips: Do a quick forecast check: wind and low cloud can hide the sunrise even on otherwise clear days.
If you’re unsure about a junction in the dark, pause and confirm your bearings rather than guessing.
warnings: Go slowly on the stairs and keep your hands free — it’s easy to misstep in low light.
If the trail feels slippery after rain, consider watching from the hostel terrace instead.

steps.name: Walk to the staircase
steps.text: From the hostel, walk ~350 m toward Sorrento on the main road until you spot the staircase climbing uphill.

steps.name: Climb to the house
steps.text: Follow the stairs to the old white house, then turn left onto the woodland trail.

steps.name: Take the right branch
steps.text: When the woodland trail branches, keep right and continue until you can see the sea.

steps.name: Turn left to the viewpoint
steps.text: After the trail opens out to the sea, head left to reach the viewpoint (scramble up carefully if you want a higher perch).

faqs.q: Can I just watch sunrise from the hostel?
a: Yes — the hostel terrace is the simplest option and the sun rises to the left of the building when you’re facing the sea.

faqs.q: How long does the hike take?
a: It’s a short route, but timing depends on your pace and how long you spend at the viewpoint. Leave enough time to arrive 10–15 minutes before sunrise.
